“At Bethany, we learn, grow, and serve in community. We value our Brethren heritage and the rich biblical and theological streams that have shaped us. We hope that our teaching and research open up new possibilities for students and the church as we live into the future to which God is calling us.”
Steven Schweitzer, Academic Dean and Professor
We are more than an institution
“Bethany is more than an academic institution. It is a community of people seeking to live out their faith boldly in a way that enables the world to flourish.”

Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL)
Master of Arts: Theopoetics and Writing
completion of a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or higher;
ability to do theological study at the graduate level as determined from the scope and quality of the applicant’s undergraduate program and academic references;
compatibility of the applicant’s personal and vocational objectives with the objectives and resources of the Seminary;
evidence of personal maturity and leadership potential as determined from references, interviews, and other data.
Please have all application materials completed within thirty days of application
Continuing education units (CEUs) may be available for audits. The cost for CEUs is $10. For more information, please contact
, director of the Brethren Academy for Ministerial Leadership.
Bethany Theological Seminary alumni are eligible for an application fee waiver for auditing a course. The Admissions Office may request a letter from the registrar verifying your alumni status.
